p: Ongoing studies are attempting to determine the suitability of nanoparticles as elicitors in the in vitro cultures. Currently used elicitors are either biotic agents derived from biological sources, such as components of fungal and bacterial cell wall structures (polysaccharides, glycoproteins, inactivated enzymes, curdlan, chitosan), or abiotic factors of chemical or physical origin (heavy metal salts, osmotic stress, mechanical damage, ultraviolet radiation) [ 11]. Nanometal particles have shown a high capacity for attaching to plant tissues and activate enzymatic pathways responsible for the production of secondary metabolites [ 12]. They also contribute to the peroxidation of cellular membranes in plant cells and influence the expression of genes responsible for the production of biologically active compounds [ 13].
